column4: whats the command to move one folder to another one in the terminal?
mv folder to_another_folder/
yep pretty much that. you may have to have a look at the "-r" option, though
cp -r /mnt/hdb5/bin /mnt/
what does the -r do, i think i missed that part
it copies subfolders too
will it just sit there untill its done (its over a gigs worth of stuff that im shifting) ?
cos it doesnt sound like its doing anything
yep it will.
log in to another terminal window and do a df -h
then wait some and do another one, and watch if the size has changed. if it has, you're copying :o)
what does it say?
then wait some and do another one, and watch
hehe no u didn't :o)
cp: cannot create directory `/mnt/sda1/files/audacity/voice samples_data': Input/output error
im on a live cd, if that makes a difference
i have no idea about the live cd. maybe you're trying to copy to cd? that may not work...
ok. maybe there is some problems with the usb driver?
ok maybe the mounted disk was unmounted for some reason?
i dont see why.. :P
yep, that sounds smart. :o)
